render.tex: \textcolor{blue}{\text{Inverse of a Matrix}} \\ %text How to compute the inverse of a Matrix %

reason.tex:
%text If you know how to compute the Adjoint of a matrix, then finding inverse is easy, % \begin{align} A^{-1}=\dfrac{1}{|A|}\cdot Adj(A) \\ \end{align} \\
%text The analysis behind it is, %
\begin{align} &|A|\cdot I=A\cdot Adj(A) \\ \implies & I=A \left(\dfrac{1}{|A|}Adj(A)\right) \\ \implies & A^{-1}=\dfrac{1}{|A|}Adj(A) \end{align} \\ %text where $I$ is the identity matrix. %
